issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
In 4.2.0 with federated clouds, if I try to launch an instance from an EMI it fails to get launched. The command given was:

{code}
# euca-run-instances -k sshlogin-region-1-developers -t c1.medium emi-9c079a47 -U http://10.104.1.219:8773/services/compute
{code}

Here the credentials are sourced for an account administrator (non-eucalyptus account) in own region and we point to the federated region in the URL.

The error says:

{code}
euca-run-instances: error (InternalFailure): Failed to create group because owning user could not be identified.
{code}

But the same command will work if we create the security group in advance like this:

{code}
# euca-create-group euca-sg-1 -d "mygroup" -U http://10.104.1.219:8773/services/compute
GROUP	sg-836e0772	euca-sg-1	mygroup

# euca-authorize -P tcp -p 22 -s 0.0.0.0/0 euca-sg-1 -U http://10.104.1.219:8773/services/compute
GROUP	euca-sg-1
PERMISSION	euca-sg-1	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0

# euca-run-instances -k sshlogin-region-1-developers -t c1.medium emi-9c079a47 -U http://10.104.1.219:8773/services/compute -g euca-sg-1
RESERVATION	r-6697440a	000916664170	euca-sg-1
INSTANCE	i-143459ce	emi-9c079a47	10.104.13.18	10.104.13.18	pending	sshlogin-region-1-developers	0	c1.medium	2015-06-19T09:50:50.790Z	euca-region-2				monitoring-disabled	10.104.13.18	10.104.13.18			instance-store					hvm			sg-836e0772		x86_64
{code}

Not sure if its a bug but it would be nice if the system can create the default security group for the federated user.

Cheers,
Deependra
fields.summary: cannot create default group for the user
